ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This was a good course if you're interested in international relations from a monetary policy perspective. Not much about fiscal policy, and very Latin American-centric. Work load was light
I would definitely recommend this class. You will learn a lot about international macroeconomics and current affairs.
I would strongly recommend the course to other students
Yes I would recommend the course to another student. I would suggest it for students who have taken economics before and are looking for a less theory based course.
A good course for both the econ novice and expert. Builds on fundamental macroeconomics and real-to the date applications.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Yes, the course has taught me many concepts that i will be using going forward, both academically and professionally
I have a better intuition for economics. I have better understanding of history of financial crises.
The course built on my understanding of bridging policy with finance/economics, which will be very helpful for my concentration in IR.
